channel.title: Changing death respawn point
channel.description: How do you change the death respawn point???

item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:13, topic:154003”]So wheres this topic/tut you made???[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 01:08:14 AM[/size][hr]And lol? maybe you should look down after the poison delay? Skim through it? too lazy? oh I see, because for me, there’s a “applydead()” right fricken there… wow, and and when you ask for help you so desperate? Sad… Right below playerLevel[3] = 0; } if(playerLevel[3] == 0) is the applydead(). Please read before you try to help some one please?[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 01:10:53 AM[/size][hr][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=210407.msg1843072#msg1843072 date=1193313687]
WHY THE HELL WOULD IT BE OUTSIDE OF THE APPLYDEAD METHOD YOU STUPID NOOB… POISONING HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH DEATH!..

–

Secondly. I get a bit frustrated, when i actually explain things to people “THOUROUGHLY” … Like what to search, explain what its for, how to change ETC… Then you go and ask someone else? Or make a new topic? I spent like 15 minutes typing that tut out lol… And your ignorant enough to ignore?
[/quote]

Lol, and even tho not abut this, but poison does have to do with death… lmao (I won’t call ya noob, because I’m not pitiful like you)[/quote]

Firstly, I try to do it myself, before posting on here.

Secondly, these errors are minor, and i can fix myself within seconds…

Thirdly, Lmfao…

is the applydead(). Please read before you try to help some one please?

How about you read. That calls the method… Thats not the actual method itself -.-…

Forth.

Lol, and even tho not abut this, but poison does have to do with death... lmao (I won't call ya noob, because I'm not pitiful like you)

Im not pitiful. And poison doesn’t really. It sets a poison delay… And if you look, your poison method is quoted out. Pmsl

HMM< maybe I have eye problems… And my knowledge of programming, I can’t disagree on that :/, but understand this, I’ve been coding for 1 week exact. look at my profile, 1 week exact, why don’t YOU think back to when you just started, and I’ll bet ya, there wasn’t a bitch around like you… (or maybe there was, and now you’re acting just like him)…[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 12:58:22 AM[/size][hr]Hey, at least give me credit for not being a fauken noob, okay? “Can you help plz?” “I dont get it” “Huh” “Whats JDK?” “How do I open the item.cfg file? item.title: Changing death respawn point
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:9, topic:154003”][quote author=blitz_9100 link=topic=210407.msg1842819#msg1842819 date=1193295361]
look for public boolean ApplyDead()

then find this under it

teleportToX = 3254;
teleportToY = 3420;

it might have different coords but just change them to the place you want

to change where they spawn when they create their account just open up player.java and find

		// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet
		teleportToX = 3254;//3072;
		teleportToY = 3420;//3312;

the first coords are the ones you change on each line tops x and bottoms y

hppe this helps
[/quote]

The thing is, there is not coords under it…

[code]/* MISC STUFF /
public int PoisonDelay2 = 0;
/ public void Poison() {
if (PoisonDelay2 < 1) {
if(PoisonDelay < 1 && Poisoned == true)
{
hitDiff = misc.random(8);
sendMessage(“You start to die of poison”);
PoisonDelay = 40;
playerLevel[3] -= hitDiff;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
}
if(playerLevel[3] < 1)
{
playerLevel[3] = 0;
}
if(playerLevel[3] == 0)
{
ApplyDead();
}
}
} */

/* public void PoisonPlayer() {
PoisonDelay = 30;
Poison();
} */
public void DeadStats() {
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4004);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4005);

playerLevel[1] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4008);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4009);

        playerLevel[2] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4006);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4007);[/code] here's my client.java, and around, applydead()[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 12:47:26 AM[/size][hr]DUDE, DO YOU UNDERSTAND, I AM, NOT, THAT FLIPPEN RETARDED, I HAVE FOLLOWED YOUR ADVICE, AND IT DOESN'T WORK, OKAY???? Why the hell would I repost it if it works? huh?! Because I'm bored???[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 12:49:03 AM[/size][hr]GODDAMMIT YOU HAVE BRAIN DAMAGE...

Let me give you a mental note, whenever you talk to me, remember, I am not retarded, and you are not talking to preschoolers, I only repost, because there is a PROBLEM… Understand???[/quote]

TBH dude, you’re doing it wrong then. Because it works perfect on all servers, par yours?.. Nah it’s not the server, it’s your knowledge of programming. Don’t blame the server when you can’t do things properly.

Read full topic

then find this under it

teleportToX = 3254;
teleportToY = 3420;

it might have different coords but just change them to the place you want

to change where they spawn when they create their account just open up player.java and find

		// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet
		teleportToX = 3254;//3072;
		teleportToY = 3420;//3312;

the first coords are the ones you change on each line tops x and bottoms y

hppe this helps :)[/quote]

The thing is, there is not coords under it…

[code]/* MISC STUFF /
public int PoisonDelay2 = 0;
/ public void Poison() {
if (PoisonDelay2 < 1) {
if(PoisonDelay < 1 && Poisoned == true)
{
hitDiff = misc.random(8);
sendMessage(“You start to die of poison”);
PoisonDelay = 40;
playerLevel[3] -= hitDiff;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
}
if(playerLevel[3] < 1)
{
playerLevel[3] = 0;
}
if(playerLevel[3] == 0)
{
ApplyDead();
}
}
} */

PoisonDelay = 30;
Poison();
} */
public void DeadStats() {
playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4004);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4005);

playerLevel[1] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4008);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4009);

        playerLevel[2] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4006);
sendFrame126(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4007);[/code] here's my client.java, and around, applydead()[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 12:47:26 AM[/size][hr]DUDE, DO YOU UNDERSTAND, I AM, NOT, THAT FLIPPEN RETARDED, I HAVE FOLLOWED YOUR ADVICE, AND IT DOESN'T WORK, OKAY???? Why the hell would I repost it if it works? huh?! Because I'm bored???[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 12:49:03 AM[/size][hr]GODDAMMIT YOU HAVE BRAIN DAMAGE...
